page.title: 17A WALK ON THE DOWNS
page.content: I went with a Warden on the Downs looking at orchids, the egg, twayblade, common spotted & fly orchids. There was a flower called the bugle with petals shaped like a bugle. There is salad burnet which is edible & tasted like cucumber. There are many footpaths & from some of them you can look right down the valley. The woods are covered with bluebells & there are so many that the wood looks as if it has a carpet. The Downs are covered with trees & some have fallen over, & have got ivy all over them. We are very lucky because there are so many wild flowers to see & we use lots of books so we can identify them.
